name: Peizhao Hu
content: News | SpiRITlab Skip to main content My name is Peizhao Hu. I am an associate professor in the Department of Computer Science at RIT. I completed my Ph.D. in computer science at the University of Queensland, Australia. Before joining RIT, I was senior research engineer at NICTA (Australia's centre of research excellence). I obtained my Bachelor of computer science from the University of Wales, Swansea, United Kingdom.  (Resume) Research Interests Privacy-preserving cloud data analytics, specifically homomorphic encryption and multiparty computations Distributed systems, including mobile and pervasive computing, Blockchain (Consensus protocols, Smart Contracts) Advance networking, including software-defined networks (SDN), wireless mesh and opportunistic networks Phone: +1(585)475-4712 | Office: 70-3769 Notes for students Looking for motivated PhD students who have strong math and/or CS background. Topics include privacy-preserving machine learning with applied cryptography techniques. If you are looking for capstone projects or thesis topics, please have read the research page or students' projects and email me what you think about the project and which part best fit your background. News Invited to serve as program vice chair for PerCom2022, 1 year ago Invited to the organizing committee of PETS2021, 1 year ago Co-chairing PerCom2021 Workshops, 2 years ago Visiting Microsoft Research for Homomorphic Encryption, 2 years ago Invited to co-chair PerCom2021 Workshops, 2 years ago Subscribe to
